business.headline: HDB Financial Services eyes IPO worth $7–8 billion by end of FY24: ReportThe IPO is expected to be a mix of secondary sale and fresh capital, aiming for a valuation in the range of $7–8 billion.

Sebi employees accuse top leadership of creating toxic work environment: Report Sebi employees alleged that "shouting, scolding, and public humiliation have become a norm in meetings," creating a hostile atmosphere that has negatively impacted their mental health and work-life balance.

Risk-takers or safety seekers: Deep dive into Gen Z investment trendsAccording to a report by a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), 55% of cryptocurrency investors are Gen Zs. Additionally, 41% of investments in stocks and 25% of investments in NFTs are made by Gen Zs.
Intel at risk of losing spot in blue-chip Dow Jones index as shares plungeThe Dow Jones index, known for its price-weighted methodology, is heavily influenced by stock prices.
Sensex, Nifty end flat as investors remain cautious; financials gainThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 4.40 points lower to end at 82,555.44, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 1.15 points to close at 25,279.85.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Not al-Qaeda, it was totally Pak involvement: Ex-envoy on IC 814 hijackingIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, former diplomat to Pakistan Gopalaswami Parthasarathy spoke about the involvement of Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence in the IC 814 hijacking.

Harvinder Singh becomes first Indian archer to win Paralympic gold medalHarvinder Singh put on a dominant performance as he became the first Indian archer to win a Paralympics gold medal. Harvinder secured the medal in the final of the Men's Individual Recurve Open on September 4, Wednesday.

4 people killed, 30 injured in Georgia school shooting: ReportLaw enforcement officers in Georgia responded on Wednesday to a shooting at a high school and there appear to be victims, authorities said.

Doctor rape-murder: 'Reclaim the night' protest by thousands of women in BengalIn a powerful display of unity and defiance, thousands of women across West Bengal marched on Wednesday midnight as part of the "Reclaim the Night" campaign, demanding justice for a doctor who was allegedly raped and murdered at a hospital here last month.

Decoding Rahul Gandhi's meet with wrestlers Vinesh Phogat, Bajrang PuniaThe meeting with Rahul Gandhi has intensified speculation that Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia may enter electoral politics in the upcoming Haryana Assembly election.

Sculptor of Shivaji statue that collapsed in Maharashtra arrested from Thane24-year-old Jaydeep Apte, who sculpted the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj statue that collapsed in Maharashtra last month, was arrested in Thane district after being untraceable for nearly 10 days.

BJP's first candidate list for Haryana out, 9 sitting MLAs droppedHaryana minister Anil Vij has been fielded from the Ambala Cantt Assembly constituency while BJP Rajya Sabha MP Kiran Choudhury's daughter Shruti Chaudhury has got the party ticket to contest the Tosham seat.

How arms for Nato are ending up with gangs and terrorists in IndiaPolice recovered a pistol meant for Nato forces from two people in Punjab with criminal records last week. The spotting of such a firearm in India, however, is not an isolated one. Seizures in India of US-made weapons and those for Nato forces reveal the role of Pakistan-backed operatives in arms smuggling.

Beyond the grocery rush: What's fuelling India's instant delivery boom?Quick commerce is changing the retail landscape in India—imagine getting everything from snacks to electronic gadgets at your door in minutes. It's fast, it's fierce, and it's here to stay.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

Shops, houses burned in Telangana town after rape attempt on tribal womanVisuals from the Jainoor town showed grey smoke filling the sky as the mob burnt shops and houses. Heavy police deployment was done in the area to try and bring the situation under control.

The spy on IC 814 who was a ghost passenger in Kandahar hijack Shashi Bhushan Singh Tomar's name wasn't among the names released to the public by the team managing the IC 814 Kandahar hijack. The reason was that he was the RAW station head in Kathmandu. Had the hijackers come to know that Shashi Bhushan was on IC 814, he wouldn't have been let off alive.
Maruti Suzuki Swift CNG launch in second week of September | ExclusiveMaruti currently sells 14 CNG models in India.

Cycling, lunch and sweet: MK Stalin, Rahul Gandhi's 'brotherly' banterTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin and Congress leader Rahul Gandhi showcased their camaraderie on X, with a playful banter over cycling plans in Chennai and promises of a South Indian lunch.

BJP's big claim on wrestlers' stir after Rahul Gandhi meets Vinesh PhogatManohar Lal Khattar's reaction came hours after the Congress released a picture of Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia with Rahul Gandhi, which gave rise to speculation over the wrestlers' entry into politics ahead of Haryana election

IndiGo passenger asks Tamil pilot to make in-flight announcement in Hindi. Viral videoAn IndiGo passenger asked a Tamil pilot to make an in-flight announcement in Hindi. The video of his earnest attempt has charmed the internet.

Remembering Islamic polymath Al-Biruni and his deep dive India's timeless wisdomAl-Biruni, an intellectual giant of the Islamic Golden Age, made significant contributions to astronomy, mathematics, and Indian studies. His work remains a testament to the power of cross-cultural understanding.

Sleepless night, veg meal: RG Kar ex-principal's 'restless' stay in CBI custodySandip Ghosh, former RG Kar principal, spent a restless night in CBI custody and demanded a vegetarian meal, citing observance of Kali Puja, sources said.

Why record Indian tourists want to go to Kazakhstan, AzerbaijanA recent study reveals that Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, and Bhutan top the list of emerging countries Indians are eyeing for travel.

Union Minister's dig at Bangladesh over regime change: 'Investors won't go there'While addressing an event in New Delhi, Giriraj Singh also said that if Bangladesh becomes like Pakistan, investors will think before going there.

Travis Kelce's team dismisses break-up document with Taylor Swift as fakeTravis Kelce's representatives have dismissed a viral document claiming a pre-planned break-up with Taylor Swift as bogus. The document, which first appeared on Reddit, suggested a planned split announcement.

Thalapathy Vijay's 'GOAT' expected to break records with Rs 100 crore openingVenkat Prabhu's 'The Greatest Of All Time (GOAT)', featuring Thalapathy Vijay, is set for a massive box office debut on September 5. The film is generating significant buzz, with expectations of breaking multiple records.

Actors Kishore, Chetan on committee to probe sexual assault in SandalwoodKannada actors Chetan and Kishore Kumar have signed a petition urging the Karnataka government to form a committee to investigate sexual assault cases in the Kannada film industry. They talk about it to India Today.

Club throw: Dharambir wins gold, Pranav silver in historic 1-2 for India Paralympics: India's Dharambir and Pranav Soorma won the gold and silver medals, respectively, in the men's club throw event on Wednesday in Paris. India took its medals tally to 24 in the quadrennial event. It was the first instance of a 1-2 for India in para-athletics at the Games.

When Sharad Kumar's Ukrainian coach broke down after his Paralympics silverIndia's Sharad Kumar revealed how his Ukrainian coach Nikitin Yevhen almost broke down in tears after hearing about his silver medal win at the Paris Paralympics 2024. Sharad has been separated from Yevhen after the Ukraine-Russia war started.

Stokes trying to give himself a chance to recover before Pakistan Tests English Test skipper Ben Stokes said that he would not do anything that would aggravate his injury before the Test series against Pakistan later this year.

Duleep Trophy 2024: Schedule, livestreaming details and all you need to knowThe Indian domestic season is all set to start with the Duleep Trophy 2024 as 4 teams battle it out for the coveted trophy. Some of the big names will be taking part in the tournament, starting from September 5.

Manolo Marquez wants India to grow out of 'boring football' in match vs SyriaIndian football team head coach Manolo Marquez wants his team to grow after their drab show against Mauritius. The coach said that he is focused on finding the right combinations in the field and fix different areas in the pitch ahead of the match vs Syria.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
